required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Respiratory Rate Accuracy Verification Clinical: Pulmonary Rehabilitation Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Respiratory Rate Accuracy Verification Clinical: Pulmonary Rehabilitation

brief_summary.textblock: Study Design: This study is a comparative, single-center study. This is a minimal risk study (as defined in 21 CFR Part 56) using a non-significant risk device (as defined in 21 CFR Part 812.3). A minimum of 60 subjects will be enrolled in the study. Subject participation will last approximately 1 hour.

detailed_description.textblock:
Study Design: This study is a comparative, single-center study. This is a minimal risk study (as defined in 21 CFR Part 56) using a non-significant risk device (as defined in 21 CFR Part 812.3). A minimum of 60 subjects will be enrolled in the study. Subject participation will last approximately 1 hour.
Objective(s):
The primary objective of this study is to evaluate the two Fingertip Respiratory Rate (FTRR) algorithms performance of Nonin's Onyx 3 by attempting to demonstrate a mean error for FTRR < 1.0 BPM during spontaneous breathing.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the two Fingertip Respiratory Rate (FTRR) algorithms performance of Nonin's Onyx 3

arm_group.description: This study is a comparative, single-center study. This is a minimal risk study using a non-significant risk device. A minimum of 60 and maximum of 70 subjects will be enrolled in the study. Subject participation will last approximately 1 hour(s).

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who might be seen in a respiratory rehabilitation center.
